SEARCH
Package Backend.Control

Class LoginControl

java.lang.Object
Backend.Control.LoginControl
public class LoginControl extends Object
Controls login, registration, and password management functionality. Handles user authentication by coordinating with AuthenticationControl and UserLoginDirectoryControl. Company representatives register with default password "password" and must change it after first login.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Allen

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginControl

      public LoginControl(AuthenticationControl authCtrl, UserLoginDirectoryControl userLoginDirCtrl)
      Constructs a LoginControl with required dependencies.
      Parameters:
      authCtrl - the authentication controller
      userLoginDirCtrl - the user login directory controller

  • Method Details

    • handleLogin

      public void handleLogin(String userID, String password)
      Handles user login by verifying credentials and setting up the session. Company representatives must be approved before they can log in.
      Parameters:
      userID - the user's ID
      password - the user's password
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if credentials are invalid
      IllegalStateException - if account is pending or rejected

    • handleRegister

      public String handleRegister(String name, String companyName, String department, String postion, String email) throws IllegalArgumentException, Exception
      Handles company representative registration. Creates a new account with email as userID and default password "password". Account must be approved by career center staff before login is allowed.
      Parameters:
      name - the representative's full name
      companyName - the company name
      department - the department within the company
      postion - the position/title
      email - the company email address (becomes the userID)
      Returns:
      the assigned userID (which is the email)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if required fields are missing or invalid
      Exception - if user creation fails

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String originalPassword, String newPassword) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Changes the password for the currently logged-in user. Requires the original password for verification.
      Parameters:
      originalPassword - the current password
      newPassword - the new password to set
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no user is logged in
      IllegalArgumentException - if original password is incorrect
